alert.note: Alert for Central Panhandle Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 6:41PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Shoshone, northeastern Benewah and southeastern Kootenai Counties through 615 PM PDT... At 540 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near St. Maries, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... St. Maries, St. Joe, Cataldo and Calder. This includes Interstate 90 in Idaho near mile marker 40. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
